title: Valentine-themed mobile interactive choice flow (bad bad vs pookie)

requirements.summary: Create a cohesive mobile-first pink Valentine theme applied consistently across layout, typography, buttons, and dialogs.
acceptanceCriteria: On a phone-sized viewport, the layout is clearly mobile-first (no horizontal scrolling, readable text, appropriately sized touch targets).
The UI uses a consistent pink-forward Valentine aesthetic (e.g., soft pink background gradients, heart motifs, playful rounded shapes) without relying on blue/purple as primary colors.
All interactive elements (buttons/dialogs) share consistent styling (radius, shadows, hover/press states).

file_operations.description: Add global Valentine theme tokens (pink-forward CSS variables), base typography defaults, and mobile-first layout helpers; include background styling that supports the Valentine look without introducing blue/purple as primary colors.

Extend Tailwind theme with Valentine-specific animations/utilities (e.g., pop-in, gentle bounce/press, floating) and ensure the design system supports consistent rounded shapes/shadows for buttons and dialogs.
Create a reusable mobile-first layout wrapper that applies the consistent Valentine visual theme (spacing, max widths, background layering, decorative accents).
Wire the app to use the Valentine layout wrapper as the single-page container for the entire experience (no multi-page routing).

requirements.summary: Implement the opening screen with heading "What are you?" and two prominent pop-up style options "bad bad" and "pookie".
acceptanceCriteria: The first view shows the heading "What are you?".
Two selectable options are shown with labels exactly "bad bad" and "pookie".
The options are presented in a pop-up/dialog-like style (e.g., centered card/modal appearance) suitable for mobile.

file_operations.description: Create the opening centered card/modal-like UI that renders the heading text exactly "What are you?" and two prominent actions labeled exactly "bad bad" and "pookie"; use shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., Card/Button if available) to achieve consistent dialog-like styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Render the opening ChoiceCard as the initial view and connect option selections to in-app state transitions (single page).

requirements.summary: On selecting "bad bad", show a dialog with "no you're pookie" and a go-back action to return to the initial choice screen.
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping "bad bad" displays a dialog/popup with the message exactly "no you're pookie".
The dialog includes a "go back" action that returns the user to the initial "What are you?" choice screen.
The user can repeat the flow multiple times without needing a page refresh.

file_operations.description: Implement a modal/dialog that displays the text exactly "no you're pookie" and provides a clear go-back action; use the shadcn-ui Dialog component for accessible modal behavior and consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add state handling to open/close the BadBadDialog when "bad bad" is selected and return the user to the initial ChoiceCard when go-back is pressed (repeatable without refresh).

requirements.summary: On selecting "pookie", show a romantic Valentine message screen/dialog with the required sentiment emphasized and readable on mobile.
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping "pookie" shows the Valentine message as the main content.
The message appears in English and includes all the requested phrases/sentiment (amazing person, makes me smile, highlight of my day, special, love you).
The message screen/dialog is styled romantically (e.g., heart accents) and remains readable on small screens.

file_operations.description: Create a romantic modal/dialog (or full-screen mobile modal) that presents the Valentine message as primary content, styled for readability with heart accents; use shadcn-ui Dialog (and optional Card) for consistent dialog presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add state handling to open the PookieMessageDialog when "pookie" is selected and allow returning to the initial ChoiceCard (keeping the experience single-page).

requirements.summary: Add lightweight playful animations (pop-in dialogs, tap feedback, floating heart confetti) with smooth mobile performance.
acceptanceCriteria: Dialogs/options animate in with a subtle pop-in effect.
Any decorative animation does not cause noticeable jank on a typical mobile device (maintains smooth interactions).

file_operations.description: Implement a lightweight, GPU-friendly heart confetti overlay that can be triggered on selection, using minimal DOM nodes and CSS animations to keep mobile performance smooth.
Add/adjust keyframes and animation utilities for subtle pop-in, gentle bounce/press feedback, and floating hearts; ensure durations/easings are tuned for smooth mobile interactions.
Apply tap/press feedback styles and subtle entrance animation to the opening choice UI, keeping touch targets large and interactions responsive.
Apply subtle pop-in animation on open and consistent button press feedback within the dialog; keep motion gentle and performant. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply subtle pop-in animation on open and optionally trigger HeartConfetti in a lightweight way; ensure the message remains readable and motion does not distract. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Trigger HeartConfetti on option selections (especially "pookie") and ensure animation state resets cleanly so the user can repeat the flow multiple times.

requirements.summary: Add and visibly use the required generated static images from frontend/public/assets/generated without backend involvement.
acceptanceCriteria: The generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the requested filenames.
The UI visibly uses the generated images (e.g., background/hero decoration and small heart stickers).
No backend calls are used to serve or transform these images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated image asset exactly at frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-bg.dim_1080x1920.png for use as the Valentine-themed background (served statically).
Add the generated image asset exactly at frontend/public/assets/generated/heart-stickers.dim_512x512.png for decorative heart sticker accents (served statically).
Add the generated image asset exactly at frontend/public/assets/generated/cupid-arrow.dim_512x512.png for a cupid-arrow decoration (served statically).

Wire the static images into the UI as visible decorations: use frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-bg.dim_1080x1920.png as the background layer and place frontend/public/assets/generated/heart-stickers.dim_512x512.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/cupid-arrow.dim_512x512.png as small accent images in the layout.

Use the sticker/arrow images (frontend/public/assets/generated/heart-stickers.dim_512x512.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/cupid-arrow.dim_512x512.png) to romantically frame/emphasize the message while maintaining readability on small screens.
